attributes.additional_details: MPs received a pay rise last year and in fact the past 10 years they have had a rise from 65k to this eye watering figure of 79k. It's above inflation and during a time when we are seeing cuts to our services . I propose that this year MPs receive no pay rise and the funds instead are invested into helping our most vulnerable in society such as homeless veterans.
attributes.background: The current salary for an MP is £77,379. MPs also receive expenses to assist them with staff costs, travel food and having somewhere to live in London . In 2019 it has been proposed that their salary should rise to £79,468. Which is a rise of 2.7 percent.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government. 

You can find out how to contact IPSA here: 

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
